subject: Excise and custom duty exemption
text: HTr 77ci4 <TTHT gfaarot 4414 Phone 91.11-25074100/25074200 (M WRaat, Hro 4ar7 3< TTATf T7T4_ Y54H / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India QA. IExtn : 2223 2318 2468 2553 (Ministry of Shipping, Road Transport and Highways) #1-5 Qa 6, #vz(-10, ETrAT, 7 fr+it-110 075 G-5 & 6 Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No. 11041/121712007-Admn: th October 2007 POLICY MATTERS-ADMINISTRATIONFINANCE (18 42007) [Decision taken on Note No: 11014/15/2001/Tech/GM (WB) dated 11.09.2007 On the recommendations of the Committee on Public Underlakings (COPU); the issue regarding Excise and Custom Duty exemption has been reviewed. 2 For the sake of clarity of the bidders, it has been decided with the approval of Competent   Authority that   following sub-clause under 14.3 of  standard   bidding documents may be incorporated in all future contract documents so that bidders should quote the prices excluding Custom/Excise Duty, as applicable exemption available t0 externally aided projects "14.3.1 Bidders may ascertain the Excise and Custom Duty exemption available for this project as per the relevant policy of Government of India prevailing 28 days before submission of bid 3 All Technical Divisions are requested to take appropriate action on the above line, for compliance in future contracts. 10 (V: K Sharrha) General Manager (Admn:) To All officers of NHAI HQs NHIAJ
